title: SKOP warns of tougher movement if New Mooring terminal leased out
body: Leaders of Sramik Karmachari Oikya Parishad on Wednesday warned that they would wage blockade programme if managements of New Mooring terminal of Chattogram Port was leased out to foreign company. SKOP a combine of 14-labour right bodies organised a rally in front of the National Press Club where labour leader Badal Khan chaired. Socialist Labour Front president Razequzzaman Ratan said that the interim government already leased out two terminals to foreign companies. They are also planning to lease out managements of profitable New Mooring terminal of Chatogram Port to a foreign company, Razequzzaman said. He called on the government to refrain from leasing out the terminal, otherwise labour bodies would wage blockade programmes of the ports. Labour leaders Chowdhury Ashiqul Alam, Mahbubul Alam, Ahsan Habib Bulbul, Hosne Ara and others spoke at the rally. The rally was followed by a protest procession that paraded different city roads.
